newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan expects over 11 mln-bale cotton crop.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan expects over 11 mln-bale cotton crop.

text.p: Pakisitani agriculture authorities said on Sunday they expected a cotton production of more than 11 million bales (375 pounds each) from the 1996/97 (July/June) crop despite a White Fly pest attack.

A government statement quoted the Food and Agriculture Ministry secretary Zafar Altaf as telling a meeting of Federal Committee on Agriculture that the propects of cotton yield were bright and damage by White Fly was negligible.
"The estimates show that the country will have more than 11 million bales," he said.
The estimated production will be more than a target of 10 million bales earlier set by the government and the 1995/96 crop of 9.96 million bales.
Cotton rates in the Pakistani market rose on Sunday owing to a rise in demand amid rumours of a serious pest damage to the crop in the main growing Punjab province.

The chairman of cotton traders' Karachi Cotton Association, Maqbool Sadiq, said last month Pakistan could export more than two million bales of cotton if had a crop of around 11 million bales, while the rest would be enough to meet domestic needs.
